intro: Raoulia goyenii, commonly known as the Goyena raoulia, is a flowering plant native to the island of New Caledonia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, with five petals and a prominent central stamen. Raoulia goyenii is often found in moist, shaded environments within the tropical rainforests of New Caledonia.
